movesets.name: Defensive

items.name: Leftovers
items.description: Heals 1/16 of max HP each turn.

movesets.description:
Moves

Wish is Aromatisse's only reliable form of recovery, but it is also able to provide good support by healing teammates. Protect guarantees the recovery, as well as allowing recovery from Leftovers and scouting Choice-locked attacks. Moonblast is used as a STAB attack, and is able to OHKO Haxorus after Stealth Rock. Aromatherapy provides further team support by removing any status effects and is especially useful against Sableye, which Aromatisse hard counters.

Set Details

The EVs are used to maximize physical bulk, as Aromatisse's greater physical bulk is the only reason for it to be used over Florges. Leftovers gives it passive recovery. Aroma Veil grants immunity to Taunt and Encore.

Usage Tips

Aromatisse's resistance to Dark-, Bug-, and Fighting-type attacks lets it switch into threats such as Mega Absol and Mienshao. Its Dragon-type immunity comes in handy against Haxorus, Flygon, and Hydreigon, preventing them from using their high-powered STAB attacks. Wish and Protect are used for reliable recovery but should be used sparingly, as they could otherwise give an opponent a free turn to boost up. Be aware of phazers too, as they are able to bypass Protect and mess up Wish recovery.

Team Options

Bulky Water-types such as Swampert, Suicune, and Alomomola are able to check wallbreakers like Victini and Darmanitan, which otherwise plow straight through Aromatisse. Specially defensive Umbreon, Snorlax, and Blissey can take care of special attackers such as Roserade, Nidoqueen, and Nidoking. In return, Aromatisse handles Mienshao and Mega Absol. Mega Blastoise can also be used to clear entry hazards and appreciates Aromatisse's ability to both pass Wishes and deal with Sableye, the only common spinblocker that can check Mega Blastoise.

movesets.name: Trick Room

items.name: Safety Goggles
items.description: Protects the holder from weather-related damage and powder moves.

items.name: Sitrus Berry
items.description: Restores 1/4 of the max HP when at 1/2 HP or less. One-time use.

movesets.description:
Moves

Trick Room is the focus of this set, as Aromatisse's helpful ability, typing, and stats make it one of the most reliable setters in the tier. Moonblast is a reliable STAB move, and is preferred over Dazzling Gleam due to how weak Dazzling Gleam is coming from Aromatisse. Heal Pulse is great for healing teammates without reliable recovery, such as Heatran, Conkeldurr, and Escavalier, that tend to find themselves getting worn down easily. If Heal Pulse is not being used, Reflect or Light Screen can be used in the third slot. The choice is up to the user to decide what their team needs more, with each boosting the team's Defense or Special Defense, respectively. Protect is an extremely important move, as it scouts for Fake Out, punishes double targeting, and also adds to Aromatisse's longevity.

Set Details

Aroma Veil is the preferred ability, as it makes Aromatisse immune to one of the most common anti-Trick Room tactics, Taunt. Aroma Veil also protects its teammates from Taunt, meaning that even if it cannot get Trick Room up, there is a good chance that its teammates will be able to. Healer is also a viable option, as most opponents will not Taunt Aromatisse in the first place due to it possibly having Aroma Veil, and it can be helpful for removing burn from the likes of Mega Mawile and Escavalier. Do note, however, that once Healer has been revealed, your opponent will have an easy time stopping Aromatisse with Taunt. Safety Goggles is the preferred item to beat sleep, another common anti-Trick Room tactic. Sitrus Berry can be helpful, however, to keep Aromatisse in the match for longer, though it does make it more vulnerable to Pokemon such as Amoonguss and Venusaur. The EV spread with a Relaxed nature allows Aromatisse to survive Life Orb Bisharp's Iron Head, helping ensure that Trick Room is set up. A Relaxed nature and 0 Speed IVs further increases its Speed to speed it up in Trick Room, allowing it to move before Pokemon like Amoonguss when Trick Room is in effect.

Usage Tips

Aromatisse usually functions best as a Trick Room lead due to its ability to almost guarantee that Trick Room goes up. It does not have to lead, however, and can set up Trick Room later in the game if need be. If led with, Aromatisse can also set up dual screens while its partner sets up Trick Room under the protection of Aroma Veil. If a possible Fake Out user is on the opponent's side of the field, Protect should be used in order to avoid it. It's also best to try to set up Trick Room as soon as possible in order to assist teammates immediately. If Sitrus Berry is used as the item, make sure to be careful of possible sleep inducers, and if Healer is used, make sure to be careful of potential Taunt users. Aromatisse is a Pokemon that should be played very actively, switching in and out to replenish Trick Room and dual screens.

Team Options

Slow Pokemon such as Heatran, Aegislash, Conkeldurr, Mega Mawile, Azumarill, Escavalier, and Mega Abomasnow make good partners as they can use Trick Room to its fullest extent. Heatran and Conkeldurr can also defeat Steel-types with their super effective STAB moves, making them even more helpful. Other Trick Room setters such as Cresselia, Reuniclus, Jellicent, Slowking, and Dusclops are also good partners for this set, as they can set up Trick Room after Aromatisse has fainted, and also appreciate Aroma Veil support. Fake Out support from the likes of Hitmontop and Scrafty is helpful, as it can neuter a Pokemon that could possibly KO Aromatisse. Rage Powder and Follow Me support from Amoonguss or Jirachi fall in a similar boat as they draw attacks away from Aromatisse, allowing it to set up Trick Room with greater ease. Lastly, Steel-type Pokemon like Heatran, Aegislash, Ferrothorn, and Escavalier make good partners, as they can easily absorb the Steel- and Poison-type attacks that trouble Aromatisse, while Aromatisse can take the Fighting-type attacks they hate.

moves.name: Aromatherapy
moves.description: Cures status on the user's team.

moves.name: Aromatic Mist
moves.description: The user raises the Special Defense stat of itself and ally Pokemon by 1.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Calm Mind
moves.description: Boosts Special Attack and Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Captivate
moves.description: Lowers an opposite gender foe's Special Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Charge Beam
moves.description: 70% chance to boost Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Charm
moves.description: Lowers foe's Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Dazzling Gleam
moves.description: Deals damage to all adjacent foes.

moves.name: Disable
moves.description: Prevents the last move used from being used again for 2-5 turns.

moves.name: Disarming Voice
moves.description: This attack never misses.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Draining Kiss
moves.description: Deals damage to one adjacent target. The user recovers 75% of the HP lost by the target, rounded up. If Big Root is held by the user, the HP recovered is 1.3x normal, rounded half down. Makes contact.

moves.name: Dream Eater
moves.description: Leeches 50% of the damage dealt. Only works if target is asleep.

moves.name: Echoed Voice
moves.description: Power increases when used consecutively.

moves.name: Energy Ball
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Fairy Wind
moves.description: Deals damage to one adjacent target.

moves.name: Flail
moves.description: Does more damage as HP decreases.

moves.name: Flash
moves.description: Lowers foe's accuracy 1 stage.

moves.name: Flash Cannon
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Giga Impact
moves.description: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Gyro Ball
moves.description: Does damage based on the foe's Speed and the user's Speed.

moves.name: Heal Pulse
moves.description: Heals the target by 50% its max HP.

moves.description: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Light Screen
moves.description: Lowers damage from special attacks for 5 turns.

moves.name: Misty Terrain
moves.description: For five turns, Grounded Pokemon cannot have major status problems or confusion inflicted on them by other Pokemon. Their Dragon-type moves are weakened by 50%.

moves.name: Moonblast
moves.description: Deals damage to one adjacent target with a 30% chance to lower its Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Odor Sleuth
moves.description: Blocks evasion modifiers. Allows Fighting- and Normal-type moves to hit Ghosts.

moves.name: Protect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Psych Up
moves.description: Copies the foe's stat changes.

moves.name: Psychic
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Special Defense 1 stage.

moves.name: Psyshock
moves.description: Damage is based on the target's Defense stat.

moves.name: Rain Dance
moves.description: Summons rain for 5 turns.

moves.name: Reflect
moves.description: Lowers damage from physical attacks for 5 turns.

moves.name: Refresh
moves.description: Removes status.

moves.name: Rest
moves.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns and restores all HP.

moves.name: Return
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Round
moves.description: Power doubles if a teammate uses Round in the same turn.

moves.name: Skill Swap
moves.description: The user and the target trade abilities.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.description: Picks one of the user's moves at random. Can only be used while sleeping.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.description: Takes 1/4 the user's max HP to create a Substitute that takes damage for the user.

moves.name: Sunny Day
moves.description: Summons sun for 5 turns.

moves.description: Confuses the target. Boosts its Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Sweet Kiss
moves.description: Confuses the target.

moves.description: Lowers evasion by 1 stage.

moves.description: 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Toxic

moves.name: Trick Room
moves.description: Slower Pokemon move first for 5 turns.

moves.name: Wish
moves.description: Heals 50% of max HP after 2 turns.

abilities.name: Aroma Veil
abilities.description: Protects allies from attacks that limit their move choices.

abilities.name: Healer
abilities.description: 30% chance to heal an adjacent teammate of a status condition every turn.
